required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Comparing Use of Manual and Power Bone Marrow Aspiration and Biopsy Devices in Children
clinical_study.official_title: A Trial of the Vidacare Powered Bone Marrow Aspiration and Core Biopsy System (OnControl by Vidacare) Compared to Traditional Manual Devices in Children

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare use of a powered bone marrow aspiration and biopsy device (OnControl) to use of a standard manual bone marrow aspiration and biopsy device to obtain bone marrow biopsy specimens in children. The hypothesis is that use of the powered device will improve the quantity and quality of bone marrow biopsy specimens when compared to the manual device.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this randomized, prospective trial is to compare use of the standard manual bone marrow aspiration and biopsy device to use of the powered bone marrow aspiration and biopsy device (OnControl) to obtain bone marrow biopsy specimens in pediatric patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent of Hematopoietic Tissue Present in Bone Marrow Biopsy Specimens Obtained Using the Manual Device and Powered Device
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 24 hours of bone marrow sampling procedure
primary_outcome.description: Bone marrow biopsy specimens will be evaluated by a blinded pathologist and measured for percent of hematopoietic tissue present. Higher percentage of hematopoietic tissue present in a biopsy specimen indicates a larger quantity of specimen for pathological evaluation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bone Marrow Biopsy Specimen Size (Length) Obtained Using the Manual Device and the Powered Device
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 24 hours of the bone marrow sampling procedure
secondary_outcome.description: bone marrow biopsy specimens will be evaluated by a blinded pathologist and measured for length.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bone Marrow Biopsy Specimen Size (Width) Obtained Using the Manual Device and the Powered Device
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 24 hours of the bone marrow sampling procedure
secondary_outcome.description: bone marrow biopsy specimens will be evaluated by a blinded pathologist and measured for width.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bone Marrow Biopsy Specimen Size (Volume) Obtained Using the Manual Device and the Powered Device
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 24 hours of the bone marrow sampling procedure
secondary_outcome.description: bone marrow biopsy specimens will be evaluated by a blinded pathologist and measured for volume

secondary_outcome.measure: Bone Marrow Biopsy Specimen Capture Rate for the Manual Device and the Powered Device
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at time of the bone marrow sampling procedure
secondary_outcome.description: number of needle passes required to capture one bone marrow biopsy specimen using the manual device and the powered device

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of Time Lapsed From Needle to Skin Contact to Bone Marrow Aspiration Specimen Acquisition Using the Manual Device and the Powered Device
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at time of the bone marrow sampling procedure
secondary_outcome.description: measurement of the amount of time required to acquire a bone marrow aspiration specimen. timing starts when the bone marrow aspiration and biopsy needle first contacts the skin and ends when the aspiration specimen has been collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Level of Post-procedural Pain Following Use of the Manual Device and the Powered Device
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 4 hours of the bone marrow sampling procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Within 4 hours of the bone marrow sampling procedure, the patient will report their level of pain post-procedure using the Wong-Baker FACES pain rating scale. The scale measures pain from 0-10, where higher numbers represent worse pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Operator Satisfaction With Manual Device and Powered Device
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 24 hours of the bone marrow sampling procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Device operators will report their level of satisfaction with use of the manual device and the powered device to perform the bone marrow sampling procedure. Level of satisfaction is reported using a 0 to 10 scale, where higher numbers represent a higher level of satisfaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of Time Lapsed From Needle to Skin Contact to Bone Marrow Biopsy Specimen Acquisition Using the Manual Device and the Powered Device
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at time of the bone marrow sampling procedure
secondary_outcome.description: measurement of the amount of time required to acquire one bone marrow biopsy specimen. timing starts when the bone marrow aspiration and biopsy needle first contacts the skin and ends when the biopsy specimen has been collected.

clinical_study.condition: Bone Marrow Aspiration and Biopsy Specimen Collection

arm_group.description: Powered bone marrow aspiration and biopsy device

intervention.intervention_name: Manual bone marrow aspiration and biopsy device
intervention.description: Use of the manual bone marrow aspiration and biopsy device to collect bone marrow aspiration and bone marrow biopsy specimens.
intervention.arm_group_label: Manual bone marrow aspiration and biopsy procedure

intervention.intervention_name: Powered bone marrow aspiration and biopsy device
intervention.description: Use of the powered bone marrow aspiration and biopsy device to collect bone marrow aspiration specimens and bone marrow biopsy specimens.
intervention.arm_group_label: Powered bone marrow aspiration and biopsy procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Informed consent and assent for minors over the age of seven years must be obtained before any trial-related activities are initiated
- Patients requiring bone marrow aspirations and/or biopsies as part of standard diagnosis and treatment
- Treated at Christus Santa Rosa Children's hospital
- Age 2 to 18 years
- Male or female
- Supportive family with willingness to participate in completing questionnaires
- English or Spanish primary language
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are pregnant
- Patients with hemorrhagic disorders such as congenital coagulation factor deficiencies disseminated intravascular coagulation and concomitant use of anticoagulants
- Patients with a skin infection or recent radiation therapy at the sampling site
- Patients with bone disorders such as osteomyelitis or osteogenesis imperfecta

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

reported_events.time_frame: Participants will be assessed for adverse events for the duration of the bone marrow sampling procedure, an average of 4 hours.
reported_events.desc: Adverse events reported to the investigators subsequent to a participant's participation will be investigated.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
